page.title: 16LIMERIGG CLIMATE
page.content: Limerigg is situated 220 metres above sea-level. The gradient is steep and in winter,Limerigg is often colder than the neighbouring villages. The surrounding ground is mainly of rough grass,thus the area is very exposed to the prevailing south-westerly wind and in winter drifting as well as heavy snow is a problem. The Black Loch sometimes freezes over completely and the children, supervised by adults,are able to ice-skate around the edge. In summer,the weather can be very pleasant and after a spell of hot weather,both children and adults from near and far come to enjoy a day's swimming in the loch.
